intro: Dissotis crenulata, commonly known as the zigzag sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in spike-like clusters, typically blooming during the wet season. Dissotis crenulata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as swamps and along riverbanks.
